1.q_string: <font size="2" face="Arial">A gas is enclosed in a cylinder with a movable frictionless piston. Its initial thermodynamic state at pressure P<sub>i</sub> = 10<sup>5</sup> Pa and volume V<sub>i</sub> = 10<sup>–3</sup> m<sup>3</sup> changes to a final state at P<sub>f</sub> = (1/32) x 10<sup>5</sup> Pa and V<sub>f</sub> = 8 x 10<sup>–3</sup> m<sup>3</sup> in an adiabatic quasi-static process, such that P<sup>3</sup>V<sup>5</sup> = constant. Consider another thermodynamic process that brings the system from the same initial state to the same final state in two steps: an isobaric expansion at P<sub>i</sub> followed by an isochoric (isovolumetric) process at volume V<sub>f</sub>. The amount of heat supplied to the system in the two-step process is approximately</font>

<font size="2" face="Arial">An accident in a nuclear laboratory resulted in deposition of a certain amount of radioactive material of half-life 18 days inside the laboratory. Tests revealed that the radiation was 64 times more than the permissible level required for safe operation of the laboratory. What is the minimum number of days after which the laboratory can be considered safe for use?</font>
